title: Can We Talk About Malphite?
body:
As Riot goes over champions with poor playstyles, can we please discuss and look over Malphite for a complete rework?  In terms of pure balance I think he's in a decent spot, but his entire kit tends towards boring, detached gameplay, both for Malphite and his opponents.

Look at Malphite in lane.  He does basically one thing, spam Q until his enemy wants to scream.  As a point and click nuke, there's literally no counter-play besides not getting in range and playing passive.  If you try to engage it steals your move speed, giving Malphite the ability to further disengage.  Add to the fact that Malphite needs to completely disengage to restore his passive, and you get some of the most boring matchups in the game in Malphite lanes.

After lane Malphite quickly becomes an ult bot, which is it's own issue.  There's almost no reason to consider Malphite during teamfights after his ult is down.  He doesn't do enough damage across his other spells to give him the power of a bruiser and his Q isn't spammable enough to be extremely useful.  His ult, while great, is all that defines him outside of lane, which is a problem.

I think they need to make him a more distance based character; boulders do gain speed as they roll down hill.  Make his Q a skillshot that gains damage and slow as it travels, and make his ult the same.  At the same time, shift damage away from his ult and Q, and give him more utility and damage in his W.

I'd like to see a Malphite that's fun to play, and considering his high win rate with skilled players but still very low pick rate, I don't think we're there.

Honestly I think Malphite needs a full VGU (Riot seems to think this) because of how much of an ult bot he is.  If his ult is down, then he's not very useful outside of lane. And not to mention his ridiculous AP scaling on it. 

I can't speak for all tank mains, but Malphite is honestly one of the most boring champions I have ever played (and I've played a lot). Outside of his ult it doesn't feel like he does much, probably because his ult has so much reliable power. 

One direction I think they should take Malphite is to play up the fact that he's a walking mountain. That his very presence is causing the area around him to shatter with each step. Sort of like he's accidentally terraforming (or just causing earthquakes) the land. 

Hell, a full VGU of Malphite could allow Riot to experiment with the grounded CC more.

I agree with this, but I also think calling a champion an "ult bot" can be misleading, as it implies that the champion needs to have power taken from their ult and placed onto their basic abilities, as happened with Sejuani. For sure, Malphite is an ult bot in that he either ults or whiles away the time in-between, but I think the issue stems from his basic abilities, and how little power they can be given for the reliability that they have.

Nerfing Malph's ult could be a possibility, but I think there's value in keeping its core free-targeted dash + AoE knockup combo as the upper bound for what constitutes the most reliable initiation ult around. The issue with his kit, however, is that everything else about him is ultra-reliable as well: his Q is  a point-and-click nuke, his W is two steroids, one of which is a permanent passive, and his E is a PBAoE effect, which serves no purpose but to auto-punish enemies he gets close to. Because his kit can't really miss or be mitigated in any way, besides having his passive be placed on constant cooldown, Malphite can't really afford to have great crowd control outside of his ult, or interesting defensive abilities. He doesn't have to be Sion levels of unreliable, but he should definitely have more of a sliding scale between power and reliability so that he can pull off more impressive moves if he plays right. Going with the above idea of terraformation and being a literal force of nature, having Malphite take the time to alter his surroundings, or stop himself for brief periods of time, could insert some unreliability into his abilities in a manner that would be thematically fitting.

As an aside, I wish Sejuani's changes also didn't operate by draining power from her ult, because I think her issue was pretty much the same, in that her basic ability power was poorly allocated through ultra-reliable and relatively boring abilities (her old W and E were especially uninteresting). Making her ult stun single-target did pave the way for more power on her basic abilities, but I'd argue their power allocation is even worse now, as her aura doesn't generate that much gameplay in practice, and the current implementation of her E and shatter damage makes her way too focused on single targets, when she should be disrupting multiple enemies at a time. Weakening her ult took away from one of her high moments for not that much benefit, and I hope the same doesn't happen to Malphite.

You can't shift power into basic abilities without shifting it from somewhere.

If Malphite is balanced right now and you simply buff or rework all his basic abilities to be more impactful then you are directly overpowering Malphite.

If more power is put into basic abilities less power needs to be on his ult.

You are forgetting that reliability itself is a form of power. Subtracting reliability from a kit is therefore a direct subtraction of power. If you were to replace that reliability with other forms of power, such as more impactful CC, you could therefore end up with an equally powerful kit. 

What I am advocating for Malphite is to tone down the reliability of his basic abilities, all of which are way too reliable and not nearly interactive enough, and instead strengthen them into more interesting tools that would allow him to do cool things in-between ult casts. None of this requires nerfing his ult.

It's manageable, as I don't play draft so I don't get to choose who I lane against, but I have played a shitton of Malphite games. The bright side of laning against an AP is that you do get to go the "yolo AP" build at the beginning to be a threat against the enemy so that they will show you a little more respect, as there are quite a number of MR items with AP. 

Or you could go all the way and do a Luden's+tank setup, which gives stupid early burst that a squishy will also have to be wary about. Besides, if they build more MR to counter you, you counter by getting MR yourself and make top lane a wet noodle fight, problem solved.

Last solution is... just go full AP. It always works as long as the enemy has a squishy (AP supports, ADC or glass cannon AP carries), just keep an eye on their items and pick your 1 shot targets wisely. If the entire team invests in heavy MR just for you, your {{champion:91}} is gonna eat them alive anyway.
